info.name: Explosion
info.description: DnD viable version of Megumin's Explosion Spell.
info.author: Kurohimiko (Original version by u/HipsterBird)

description.p: You conjure your magical power and unleash it onto a point of your choosing within range, causing devastating effects to anything in range.Each creature in a 20-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes full damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners and ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
If cast using a 2nd level spell slot or higher non-magical objecta that aren't being worn or carried also take the damage.

This spell, when cast, allows you to consume any number of spell slots and is treated as the highest level spell slot consumed. The spell deals 1d10 fire damage, plus 1d6 fire damage for each spell slot level consumed.
The Explosion Spell Slots table shows the damage increase as well as the stats for using higher spell slots.

(Example: an 8th level wizard using four 1st level spell slots, three 2nd and 3rd level spell slots, and two 4th level spell slots would deal 1d10 + 27d6 fire damage with the casting, range, and radius treated as a 4th level spell as indicated in the Explosion Spell Slots table.)

At Higher Levels. If you cast this spell using a 9th level spell slot, you are able to tap into the rawest form of magic. During casting you can decide what type of damage is dealt between fire damage and force gamage. If cast using force damage fire does not spread or ignite flammable objects.

setters.set: an eyepatch worth at least 1 gp

description.p: An extravegant eyepatch used to either cover an empty eye socket or for traveling at night or in the dark.
Poor Perception.While wearing an eyepatch, due to limiting your vision to one eye, you have disadvantage on all perception checks.
Adjusted to the Dark.While wearing an eyepatch, and still having both eyes, you can see in darkness as if it were dim light for 20 ft by uncovering your eye.
